Articles.Content: I am quite surprised by the numbers in this poll. I really didnt expect to so many young players.
I'm a technologically preserved 115 year old with a laser eyeball.
Ich bin fÃƒÂ¼nfzehn Jahre alt.

I'm 16, but I am surprised that there are so many older people kicking around here. Still, hope for the future I guess, I wouldn't mind playing an occasional bit of KSP when I'm 40! Course, it'll be 2036 then...

Sad thing is that you'll be 40 before you know it... Someone once told me that people's perception of time changes as they get older because their frame of reference changes along with their age. When you're 10, 5 years is an extremely long time because it's half your life. When you're 30, 5 years isn't nearly as long. When you're 50, 25 years seems as long as as 5 years did when you were 10. If that is true, then the objective middle of our lives is somewhere around 18... You're just about over the hill, kid.

Edited June 22, 2013 by PakledHostage

Turning 13 in about 2 days, so...

12.

I always say I'm 29, and born in May, to protect my identity. But you all seem like nice-not-going-to-kill-me-in-my-sleep kinds of people.
You clearly don't know some of us well enough... MUAHAHAHAHA

Sad thing is that you'll be 40 before you know it... Someone once told me that people's perception of time changes as they get older because their frame of reference changes along with their age. When you're 10, 5 years is an extremely long time because it's half your life. When you're 30, 5 years isn't nearly as long. When you're 50, 25 years seems as long as as 5 years did when you were 10. If that is true, then the objective middle of our lives is somewhere around 18... You're just about over the hill, kid.

Who're you calling kid?! But yeah, that sounds pretty much what I've heard about getting older, best enjoy it while I can...

I'd be the reverse you, only male and not 12. I'm 15 but feel at least 2 years ahead mentally than most of my age group. As one of the "geeks" (i.e the people who don't conform to trends and who are not stupid (not saying everyone beside the "geeks" are stupid, but you get what I mean) I was bullied for two years . I've been fascinated by space and space exploration my whole life and, needless to say, I got a major nerdgasm when I found KSP!

Who're you calling kid?! But yeah, that sounds pretty much what I've heard about getting older, best enjoy it while I can...

It's true. The 90's still seem recent to me. I'm 40 in October.
I'm somewhere between owning a Voltron and calling Pat Robertson "That silly young chap."
I'd like to see the poll again but with more specific age ranges.

10 It looks I'm one of the younger.

Sometimes I'm saying that I'm 21,just cause.

Edited June 22, 2013 by EvilotionCR2

10 It looks I'm one of the younger,crap.
10! Thats indeed very young! I already said it but i'm 17.
33, and the years just keep coming faster and faster. At this rate I'll be 50 next year...

33, and the years just keep coming faster and faster. At this rate I'll be 50 next year...

Shhh... I'm hoping the years will just forget I'm here

30 here.

filler
Just turned 31
39 ... I feel so old compared to the majority!
I'll be 50 in August.

Quite. I might have been interested, but I didn't study the maths behind orbital mechanics until I was 18 (I'm a 39 year old woman). I guess the game can be mastered without knowing about conic sections, eccentricity and suchlike, but it would make the learning curve much harder. Good for those picking it up early and making their space programme work!

I've always been interested in science (including aerospace - being born a month before Apollo 13, and growing up with the Shuttle and semi-regular postcards from the Voyagers, will do that to ya), but not so much the maths; I can struggle through the latter, but it's not "fun." Thank goodness for tools like the web-based planetary-transfer calculators and the (now stock, and thus often taken for granted) orbital map/maneuver node system.

And as the above dates indicate, I'm in the 40+ range.

This takes quite some courage,but I will admit that i'm 13.(Not the idiotic kind of 13 year old) My current phase of interest has shifted from Archaeology to Astronomy.I have good grades i'm an Air cadet and i'm 100% dedicated to becoming an Astronaut some day
Nowt wrong with being 13 Voyager, I was once (at the time of the Gemini program) ~ my son is in the ATC and hopes to join the RAF. Good luck to you.
38 in december here !

It's true. The 90's still seem recent to me.

Truth. I have to pinch myself when I realize that Kurt Cobain's been dead for nearly 20 years.

I'm 13 years old. Cool to see other 13 year olds playing.

Edited June 23, 2013 by unwisemonk
